deck: Artist, Inker, Colorist & Writer
description: Mary "Zorilita" Bellamy is an illustrator and animation assistant that's been working in comics since 2000. She began her work in comics in 2000 as an inker for Shanda Fantasy Arts and moved on to work on anthologies with Antarctic Press and Radio Comix, among others. Later, she became the editor for the Womanthology Sketchbook project as well as an artist contributor and colorist for the Womanthology: Heroic and Womanthology: Space graphic novels published through IDW Publishing. She currently is a cover artist for My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic published through IDW Publishing. In between official comic book projects she also illustrates licensed artist trading cards for various comic properties including Adventure Time, Ghostbusters, Lady Death, Ninja High School, Walking Dead, Transformers, DC Comics, Marvel and Star Wars and self publishes her own graphic novel series, Ah Heck!! - The Angel Chronicles and Faux Facts - The Truth Can Be Strange! which previously appeared in Radio Comix' Mangaphile and Shanda Fantasy Arts New Horizons.
name: Mary Bellamy

deck: Walter Frehm is an artist who created the Green Mask and worked for Ripley's Believe it or not.
description:
Career

Walter Frehm was born in New York, New York.  Frehm worked as an artist and writer and created characters like the Green Mask for Fox Comics.  He later worked for Ripley's Believe it or not.  He ended up writing a mini biography in a Believe it or not cartoon seen on the lower right.

Personal Life

Walter marries Estelle and had two sons Kenneth and Rick  who had at least four grandchildren.  He loved his job and likes to play golf, ski and sail.
name: Walter Frehm

deck: Writer/Creator of Haven and Haven of Dante
description:
Leonardo Ramirez is a husband, a father, a Karate instructor with a 3rd degree black belt, and a writer. His first graphic novel, Haven of Dante, is a supernatural Young Adult story centered on an ancient war between the Dante family and the nine circles of hell. Haven of Dante: The Staff of Moshe takes readers much deeper into the world of the family line with a prologue that begins with the plight of Dante Alighieri himself!

His follow up is a Children’s Steampunk book called The Jupiter Chronicles: The Secret of the Great Red Spot. It follows the adventure of two children as they are transported to the steam-powered cities of Jupiter, find their long-lost father, stop an attack from Mars, and witness the birth of Steampunk.
name: Leonardo Ramirez

deck: Disney animator and director, best known for his work on the Genie from Aladdin
description:
Eric Goldberg was born in Bucks County, Pennsylvania. He attended Pratt Institute in 1973. He animated under Richard Williams for a time. Goldberg married his wife Susan in 1982. He was hired by Disney in 1990, and was the lead animator on the Genie in Aladdin (1992). He co-directed Pocahontas (1995).

He would later work on Phil from Hercules (1997) the Rhapsody in Blue sequence from Fantasia 2000 (1999). In 2009, Goldberg won an Annie for his work on Louis from The Princess and the Frog (2009).
name: Eric Goldberg

deck: Writer
name: Judd Stomp

deck: Artist
description:
Graduate of The Joe Kubert School of Cartoon & Graphic Art, Class of 1989. First professional work in Spotlight Comics' UNDERDOG #1 (1987), "The Eredicator, Chapter 1" (pencils & inks), and UNDERDOG #2 (1987), "Prisoner of Love" (cover art, pencils and partial inks). Regular contributor to CRACKED between 1990-2000; first appearance in CRACKED #253 (May 1990), "Skateboards Around the World", last appearance in CRACKED #348, (October 2000), "If School Was Cool". Drew cover art and interior color pull-out poster for CRACKED BLOCKBUSTER #4 (Summer 1990) and cover for CRACKED COLLECTORS EDITION #111 (July 1997); also color art for the pull-out "Extra Terrestrial Wrestling Federation" Collector Cards in CRACKED COLLECTOR' EDITION #90 - 'SCI-FI SPECIAL' (April 1992).

Drew cover art for Felix the Cat Comics' FELIX THE CAT & FRIENDS #1 (1992) and FELIX THE CAT - VIDEO WIZARD (1992); regular contributor (2000-2002) with art in FELIX CAT-A-STROPHIC WRESTLING SPECTACULAR #1 (2000, story & pencils for "A Grapple a Day Keeps the Professor at Bay"), FELIX'S SUMMER SPLASH #1 (2000, pencils for "Beach Blanket Buffoons"), FELIX THE CAT TRUE CRIME STORIES #1 (2001, pencils for "No Clue"), FELIX THE CAT'S JURASSIC JAMBOREE #1 (2001, pencils for both "Lost in the Land of the Sneezestacks" and "The Clums-a-Saurus!?!", story and art for "Dinosaurs 101"), FELIX THE CAT'S BLOCKBUSTER MOVIE BONANZA #1 (2002, pencils for "The Six Cents"), FELIX THE CAT'S MAGIC BAG OF TRICKS #1 (2002, pencils on "Meany, Myneey, Genie, Moe!"), and FELIX THE CAT'S TV EXTRAVAGANZA #1 (2002, pencils for "The Days of Our Nine Lives" and "I Love Kitty", story for "I Scream at Genie"). Several of these were subsequently collected in Dark Horse's FELIX THE CAT'S GREATEST HITS VOL. 1 (2002).

Other comics work: Fantagraphics Books' AMAZING HEROES 1990 SWIMSUIT SPECIAL, The 1991 San Diego Comic Con Souvenir Program Book, Eclipse Books' BORN TO BE WILD (1991), Kitchen Sink Press' IMAGES OF OMAHA No. 2, color back cover art for Allied American Artists' PEPITO #1 (1991) and a two-page spread ("Bathing Hippies") in Marvel Special Projects' WOODSTOCK '94 comic (1994).
name: Pete Fitzgerald

deck: Currently writing Green Lantern: New Guardians. He has previously worked on Superboy, Deathstroke and Shadowman. He also know as writer and creator of The Strange Talent of Luther Strode.
description:
Career

Justin Jordan broke into comics with his well recieved six issue series The Strange Talent of Luther Strode for Image Comics. Following the conclusion of the first Luther Strode series, in 2012, Jordan would write a short two issue arc of Hack/Slash, as well as launch The New 52 title Team 7 and a rebooted Shadowman for Valiant. In December of 2012, Jordan would go on to take writing duties for The New 52 title Deathstroke with issue #15, and launch the Luther Strode sequel, The Legend of Luther Strode. In early 2013, both Team 7 and Deathstroke would be cancelled, but Jordan would then take over writing Superboy. In February 2013, DC announced that Jordan would be taking over writing duties for Green Lantern: New Guardians. Jordan also wrote the six issue mini-series Dead Body Road. Beginning in July, Jordan will start work on a new comic for Image called Spread.
name: Justin Jordan
